name: df-fuc
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4, setvar s5, setvar s6, setvar s7, setvar s8
body: |- wceq(cfuc, cmpo(s0, s1, ccat, ccat, ctp(cop(cfv(cbs, cnx), co(cv(s0), cfunc, cv(s1))), cop(cfv(chom, cnx), co(cv(s0), cnat, cv(s1))), cop(cfv(cco, cnx), cmpo(s2, s3, cxp(co(cv(s0), cfunc, cv(s1)), co(cv(s0), cfunc, cv(s1))), co(cv(s0), cfunc, cv(s1)), csb(s4, cfv(c1st, cv(s2)), csb(s5, cfv(c2nd, cv(s2)), cmpo(s6, s7, co(cv(s5), co(cv(s0), cnat, cv(s1)), cv(s3)), co(cv(s4), co(cv(s0), cnat, cv(s1)), cv(s5)), cmpt(s8, cfv(cbs, cv(s0)), co(cfv(cv(s6), cv(s8)), co(cop(cfv(cfv(c1st, cv(s4)), cv(s8)), cfv(cfv(c1st, cv(s5)), cv(s8))), cfv(cco, cv(s1)), cfv(cfv(c1st, cv(s3)), cv(s8))), cfv(cv(s7), cv(s8))))))))))))
comment: Definition of the category of functors between two fixed categories, with the objects being functors and the morphisms being natural transformations. Definition 6.15 in [Adamek] p. 87. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 6-Jan-2017.)
